skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: Professional internal communications creation and management with templates for status reports, newsletters, announcements, team updates, and cross-functional communication. Use for: (1) Weekly/monthly status reports, (2) Company newsletters, (3) All-hands announcements, (4) Team updates, (5) Policy communications, (6) Change management communications, (7) Recognition and celebrations
skill.summary: Professional internal communications creation and management with templates for status reports, news...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown templates and HTML/CSS for email newsletters. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access capabilities. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Writing clear internal communications takes time and skill. This skill provides ready-to-use templates, best practices, and workflows for status reports, newsletters, announcements, and team updates. Save time while improving communication quality and consistency across your organization.
actual_capabilities: Generate status reports with metrics, blockers, and action items
Create company newsletters with sections for updates, recognition, and events
Write all-hands announcements with FAQ sections and timelines
Produce team updates with sprint summaries and achievements
Apply communication best practices by channel (email, Slack, wiki, video)
Follow structured workflows for crisis, feedback, and regular communications
limitations: This skill provides templates and guidance only; it does not send or distribute communications
Does not integrate with email systems, Slack, or other platforms
Does not access your organization's data or metrics automatically
Templates require manual customization with your specific content

use_cases.title: Weekly Team Status Reports
use_cases.description: Generate structured status reports with metrics, velocity, blockers, and accomplishments for stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Company-Wide Announcements
use_cases.description: Create clear announcements for policy changes, organizational updates, and important news with FAQ sections.

use_cases.title: Sprint and Team Updates
use_cases.description: Produce engaging team updates that celebrate wins, share learnings, and align priorities across the team.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly Status Report
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a weekly engineering status report
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Internal Communications skill to create a weekly status report. Include executive summary, key metrics (velocity, deployments, incidents), accomplishments, blockers and risks, upcoming priorities, and action items. Focus on [specific project or focus area].

prompt_templates.title: Team Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a sprint update using the Internal Communications skill. Structure it with sprint goal status, major achievements with impact, challenges overcome, metrics, retrospective highlights, upcoming work, and team shout-outs.

prompt_templates.title: Announcement
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an all-hands announcement for [policy or change]. Include TL;DR summary, what's changing, why it matters, timeline, action items, FAQ, and contact information. Use clear, professional tone appropriate for all employees.

prompt_templates.title: Newsletter Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a [section name] section for the company newsletter. Include [specific content requirements]. Keep it engaging and appropriate for a monthly company-wide audience.

best_practices: Lead with the most important information using the inverted pyramid structure
Always include specific action items with owners, deadlines, and priorities
Quantify impact with metrics and specific outcomes rather than general statements
Be transparent about challenges and blockers while proposing solutions
anti_patterns: Burying key information deep in the document instead of leading with it
Using vague language instead of specific metrics, names, and deadlines
Sending communications without clear next steps or action items
Using overly formal or jargon-filled language that obscures meaning

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: The Internal Communications skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance and templates that you can apply in any writing context.

faq.question: Can this skill send emails or post to Slack?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates content only. You must copy the output and send through your email client, Slack, or other platform manually.

faq.question: Does this skill access my organization's data?
faq.answer: No, this skill does not access any external data. All metrics, names, and content must be provided in your prompt.

faq.question: What formats are supported?
faq.answer: Templates support markdown for docs and wikis, and HTML for email newsletters. Best practices cover email, Slack, wiki, meetings, and video.

faq.question: How do I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Replace placeholder text in brackets like [Team Name] or [Date]. Remove sections that do not apply. Adjust formality based on your audience.

faq.question: How is this different from writing from scratch?
faq.answer: Templates ensure consistency, save time on structure, and incorporate proven communication best practices. You focus on content, not format.
